title: Rama
summary: Rama (/ˈrɑːmə/;[4] IAST: Rāma, pronounced [ˈraːmɐ] (listen); Sanskrit: राम), Ram, Raman or Ramar,[lower-greek 1] also known as Ramachandra (/ˌrɑːməˈtʃʌndrə/;[6] IAST: Rāmacandra, Sanskrit: रामचन्द्र), is a major deity in Hinduism. He is the seventh and one of the most popular avatars of Vishnu. In Rama-centric traditions of Hinduism, he is considered the Supreme Being.[7]
